description.value:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's level or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened (4th) Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed}.

All creatures in the area when you cast the spell are limned in colorful, heatless fire of a color of your choice for the duration. Visible creatures can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} while affected by faerie fire. If the creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}, they are Concealed while affected by faerie fire, rather than being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected}.

You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.
This parrying dagger features a robust guard to protect the wielder's hand.
The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

Elven chain is a chain shirt made of mithral that glitters in even the faintest light. It grants a +2 item bonus to AC and has no check penalty.

Created by elven artisans employing ancient crafting techniques, elven chain is exceptionally quiet. Unlike other chain shirts-even other mithral chain shirts-elven chain does not have the noisy trait. This suit of armor can be etched with runes like any other mithral chain shirt.

Craft Requirements The initial raw materials must include mithral worth at least 3,125 sp.
Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 5d6[poison]]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 6d6[poison]]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 8d6[poison]]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)
(cold, deadly 2d8, disarm, finesse, magical)
(agile, cold, disarm, finesse, magical, parry, versatile S)
(cold, magical, range increment 60 feet, reload 1)
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AtWillSpells]

Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

30 foot aura.

When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with +24 counteract modifier.

The graveknight unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of energy. Creatures in the area take [[/r 8d12[cold]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true] save). The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:36] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Doomed]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 doomed 2, hampered 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

The Shraen graveknight Steps once then Strikes with its rapier. A creature damaged by the attack must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|traits:damaging-effect] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed4d6.success]. On a critical failure, the attack pierces the creature's heart, and the creature dies.
The Shraen graveknight draws a weapon, then Strikes with it.

At the time of its creation, a graveknight chooses one of the following energy types that was relevant to its life or death: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Any weapon the graveknight wields gains the effects of the caustic, frost, shock, or flaming weapon rune, respectively, in addition to a +1 striking weapon rune. If the graveknight is 14th level or higher, its weapons instead gain the effects of the greater versions of both of these runes.
The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

allSaves.value: +1 status bonus to all saves vs. magic effects, +2 status bonus to all saves vs. mental effects

source.value: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands
